channel.title: Tropical/Marine Aquariums
channel.description:
Anyone have one? I'm in the process of setting mine up. It's a 120l JUWEL Rekord, and it's gunna be a tropical tank. Not sure what fish to stock it with though. I really wanted a siamese fighting fish, but that means I wont be able to keep other cool ones.
Thread for advice/tips/discussion

item.title: Tropical/Marine Aquariums
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

dammmnn. must be shit to see fish that you’ve spent so much on die. marines are really cool, and most tangs are beautiful. im getting sick of clown fish though, because everytime a 7 year old kid comes in, they just start shouting “NNEEEEMMMOOO” “DDDDOORRRYYY”. just wanna shout STFU.

Read full topic

item.title: Tropical/Marine Aquariums
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

My step dad used to have a marine aquarium, had like 3 different types of clown fish, a regal tang (Both before finding nemo!!), 4 yellow tangs, a rabbit fish, like two of them plants that sting you that the clown fish live - he had a good few more but those are the only ones that i remember the name of.

But yeah, he spent thousands on that tank and its up-keep (having to buy bags of salt water every week, filters etc) till one day, he moved it slightly, woke up the next morning and most of the fish were dead :.

Read full topic

item.title: Tropical/Marine Aquariums
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:16, topic:241680”]Got all my water in the tank y’day. Looking good apart from a bit of cloudiness. Should clean up in a few days. Got the temperature about right, at 24C, and just waiting for a bit of driftwood to soak out. Should start stocking with a few danios or tetras at the weekend.

any advice davidude? can i some pics of your tank if poss.? really interested.[/quote]
Hah perhaps a few pictures of my tank later. You will probably be surprised at how bare it is. All seems good for you so far.

Read full topic

item.title: Tropical/Marine Aquariums
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

When ever I look for fish equipment etc I always come across stuff like “Water treater, fish lazer” or some other bullshit inovation which is supposed to make keeping fish easier.

Take most water treatment solutions;

“If you are setting up an aquarium you must use this otherwise all your fish will die, it changes the PH level to 6 which is safe for all fish ever made. It is also make it so you don’t have to clean out your fish tank much, which in turn gives you more time to look at child pornography”

It’s mostly bullshit, for instance my fish, Brenda, has never had any of that. He has a heater, water filter and a light. I feed him when ever I feel like it. I change his water once every few months, clean him out at that time too. He also has a ping pong ball which he loves to play with. And how long has he been alive for? I got him 4 years ago…

However I don’t think water treatment etc is out of the question, sure with a lot of fancy fish, take Discus for instance (one of my favourite types of fish), they need a lot of care; 75% water change a week, reverse osmosis filtration, at least 20gallons of water per fish, as well as keeping the water at a constant PH value of what ever discus like, I forget.

So just be warey of those expensive products that your fish must have.

Wow I really am a fish freak…

edit - also heres a picture of a discus fish.

Read full topic

item.title: Tropical/Marine Aquariums
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

I used to be a freak with fish. Siamese fighting fish are alright to keep with other fish really. I currently have a 200L tank with one albino oscar. He is about 8-9 inches long.

If you are just starting out you’ll probably wanna stock your tank with loads of pretty, small ones. Stuff like mollies/guppies/tetras are good. However some fish you have to keep on your own, take my fish for example, he’ll rip any other fish to shreds. So choose wisely.

here is a pic of what my fish looks like:

Read full topic
